content:
# elizaos/eliza Daily Update (Jan 17, 2026)
## OVERVIEW 
Today's development focused on addressing several bug fixes related to authentication, event emission, and plugin stability, alongside introducing a new core runtime method. Several new pull requests were opened, and one issue was closed after investigation.

## KEY TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS

### Core Runtime Enhancements
The core runtime gained a new `unregisterAction` method, enhancing flexibility in managing agent actions. This feature was introduced in two separate pull requests, indicating its importance.
- [#6375](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6375)
- [#6372](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6372)

### Authentication and Environment Variable Handling
Multiple fixes were implemented to ensure proper loading of `.env` files in agent commands, crucial for authentication, and to validate directory paths in CLI operations.
- [#6376](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6376)
- [#6374](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6374)
- [#6379](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6379)

### Plugin and Server Stability Improvements
Efforts were made to improve the stability of the `plugin-bootstrap` by ensuring entity connections before saving facts and to ensure the `MESSAGE_SENT` event is emitted correctly after sending to the central server.
- [#6371](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6371)
- [#6370](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6370)
- [#6378](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6378)

## NEWLY OPENED PULL REQUESTS
- [#6379](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6379) fix(cli): validate directory path in ensureDir to prevent ENOENT error
- [#6378](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6378) fix(server): emit MESSAGE_SENT event after sending to central server
- [#6377](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6377) docs: add environment variables documentation
- [#6376](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6376) fix(cli): load .env files in agent commands for authentication
- [#6375](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6375) feat: add unregisterAction method to core runtime
- [#6374](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6374) fix: load .env files in agent commands for authentication
- [#6373](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6373) fix: send action callbacks to user in multi-step mode
- [#6372](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6372) feat: add unregisterAction method to core runtime
- [#6371](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6371) fix(plugin-bootstrap): ensure entity connection before saving facts in reflection evaluator
- [#6370](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6370) fix(plugin-bootstrap): ensure entity connection before saving facts in reflection evaluator

## CLOSED ISSUES

### Reflection Evaluator Behavior Clarified
Issue [#6364](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6364), concerning "Entity not found" errors in the reflection evaluator, was closed. It was determined that the reported behavior is not a bug but rather the intended design, where `ensureConnection()` is called, and entities are correctly searched within the room. The "Entity not found" scenario occurs when an agent attempts to create a relationship with someone not present in the room, which is handled gracefully.

## NEW ISSUES

### Embedding and Database Configuration Discrepancy
A new issue [#6380](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6380) reports that the `USE_OPENAI_EMBEDDING` setting is not being respected, leading to the use of a 384-dimension zero vector fallback while the database adapter is hardcoded for a 1536-dimension column, causing SQL errors.

### Prompt Character Limit
Issue [#6381](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6381) highlights a request to eliminate the 500-character limit in the first application prompt.

## ACTIVE ISSUES

### Discord Integration Error
Issue [#43](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/43) reports a `this.runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage' is undefined` error, indicating Discord is not working with the latest ElizaOS version. The latest comment suggests this issue is assumed to be fixed with a pending pull request in the `plugin-discord` repository, specifically when paired with `@elizaos/cli` version 1.7.1.
